DOC.brief_summary: Patients undergo vitro fertilization without intracytoplasmic sperm injection ( IVF / ICSI ) often experience impact quality life emotional maladjustment treatment outcome . Multiple contributor negative impact identify , include interference professional activity , expense related fertility treatment hormonal side effect . In-vitro maturation ( IVM ) human oocyte obtain minimally stimulate unstimulated ovary offer `` patient friendly '' treatment option conventional ovarian stimulation protocol Assisted Reproductive Technology ( ART ) treatment . Historically , IVM offer woman increase ovarian response ( so-called `` high responder '' ) , typically woman polycystic ovary ( PCO/PCOS ) , increase risk ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome ( OHSS ) conventional ART protocol use . IVM treatment program characterise minimal administration fertility hormone , less disruptive patient ' daily life reduce need hormonal ultrasound monitoring , avoid range minor major complication reduce hormonal burden procedure , aim reduce total cost infertility treatment . To facilitate application IVM treatment potentially improve overall patient experience , study compare psychological impact conventional ovarian stimulation protocol versus IVM protocol conduct ; furthermore , study investigate difference quality life two subgroup also perform . Socio-demographic data , medical characteristic follow questionnaire collect : Specific question patient fertility problem ( FertiQol ) ; Hospital Anxiety Depression Scale ( HAD ) instrument measure side effect design research group . The study group ( IVF patient IVM patient ) evaluate three predefined time point : intake , oocyte collection outcome first embryo transfer know . Descriptive analysis , intergroup comparison explanatory/predictive model dependent variable ( quality life , emotional adjustment ) perform .
DOC.brief_title: IVM Versus IVF : Differences Patients ' Emotional Adjustment Quality Life
DOC.criteria: Heterosexual homosexual woman enrol undergo ART treatment Patients polycystic ovarian morphology ( 12 small follicle observe baseline pelvic ultrasound scan ) polycystic ovary syndrome ( PCOS ) ( Rotterdam criterion , 2003 ) Medical contraindication pregnancy High ( > grade 2 ) grade endometriosis Patients previously undergone ART treatment Patients require ART PGD In vitro fertilisation sperm retrieve testicular biopsy Singles without partner Couples language barrier ( poor knowledge Dutch , French English ) reliably fill questionnaire .
